Knitr commands

  • To knit an R markdown document using the command line bash > Rscript -e "library(knitr); knit('kernelConvolution.Rmd')"

  • To use accents in Rmd

include in the header

header-includes: - \usepackage[latin9]{inputenc}

Then on a mac insert the character of interest

``` Acute ó Ó Option+E, V

Circumflex ô Ô Option+I, V

Grave ò Ò Option+`, V

Tilde õ Õ Option+N, V Only works with “n,N,o,O,a,A”

Umlaut ö Ö Option+U, V ```
